info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 9:07AM EDT until April 30 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph affecting Charlotte and Halifax Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Virginia... Roanoke (Staunton) River At Brookneal affecting Charlotte, Campbell and Halifax Counties. For the Roanoke River...including Roanoke, Pigg R Nr Sandy Level, Altavista, Brookneal, Randolph...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roanoke (Staunton) River at Randolph. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Widespread lowland flooding in fields on left bank and woods on right bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to flood stage this evening. It will then fall to 16.4 feet early Monday afternoon. It will rise to 16.8 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.0 feet on 04/26/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Roanoke (Staunton) River Randolph 24.0 21.3 Sat 8 am EDT 21.4 16.5 16.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1015 AM EDT.
